the very first resident evil film hit
theaters in 2002 and comes from writer
director paul w s anderson not to be

this is the one who set the video game
adaptation gold standard with his 1995
big screen take on mortal kombat the
kickoff to the re franchise still has
the highest audience score of the entire
series with a 67
fresh rating it's also holding on to the

that's still very rotten but hey it

corporation the world's largest business

amount of economic and political
influence around the globe and wouldn't
you know even though umbrella has a
pleasant and widely trusted public face
they also secretly dabble in all kinds
of unethical covert research into
military technology bioweaponry and

though umbrella's hometown of raccoon
city gets explored in later entries in
the series the first film mainly takes
place in just two locations a mysterious
home known as the spencer mansion and
the massive secret lap hidden underneath
known as the hive that's where umbrella
scientists are working on the
genetically engineered t virus which can

just a bit turning your subjects into an

we ultimately learned that she was part
of a plot involving some environmental

steal a copy of the t-virus but things
went about as wrong as they could
possibly go the virus was accidentally
unleashed and almost everyone in the
complex became a homicidal mutant terror
the hive has been locked down by
umbrella's artificially intelligent
control program known as the red queen
and the rest of the movie finds alice

s-t-a-r-s raccoon city's special tactics
and rescue squad the doctored photos
alice finds in the mansion showing her

the hives underground train was directly

city times has the headline horrid

kind of editorializing there let's keep

apocalypse

this series not exactly toy story
apocalypse draws key inspiration from

anderson returned once more to write the

opens five years after apocalypse after

triggered a global apocalypse because
the virus is fatal to so many kinds of
organisms it has also turned the surface
of much of the planet into a desert
which is a huge bummer human refugees
have largely abandoned cities and
started living in mobile convoys to stay

fully break with the established series
chronology the most recent game resident
evil 4 came out in 2005 but it's set in
a world that has not yet been totally

into a desert alice whose t-virus

paul w s anderson returned to the
director's chair for 2010's resident
evil afterlife and helmed all the series
remaining films starring milo jovovich
as alice this was also the first re film
to be shot in 3d anderson became
convinced to try the technology after
seeing advanced footage from james
cameron's avatar he and his crew then
spent two weeks during pre-production
just mastering their new 3d camera
system and also trying to find a role
for some nine foot tall blue aliens
afterlife includes another primary game
character wentworth miller as chris
redfield and also brings back ali larter
as claire redfield and sienna guillory
as jill valentine while debuting sean
roberts as the new albert wesker with a
new look more closely resembling his
game counterpart he replaces jason
o'mara who played wesker in extinction
notably this is chris redfield's only
appearance in all of the anderson
resident evil films aside from being
related to claire he has very little in
common with his game counterpart
afterlife is mostly based around
elements from the game resident evil 5
which came out the year before in 2009
the scarab like mind control devices and
the large-scale final confrontation with
wesker were all lifted more or less
directly from the game and the so-called
axe man mutant is visually based on the
game's executioner majini enemies

2021's welcome to raccoon city
completely reboots the franchise with no
direct connections to the previous six
films it comes from writer director
johannes roberts who previously helmed
47 meters down and the strangers pray at
night plans for a reboot were already
underway while the final chapter was
still in theaters james wan had been
attached briefly as a producer but left
the project to work on the new mortal
kombat reboot instead greg russo worked
with juan on an early script idea he
also ended up on that mortal kombat
movie they were considering a new
project more directly inspired by
resident evil 7 biohazard and the focus
on a character suffering in isolation
roberts's film on the other hand is
directly based on the first two games in
the resident evil franchise and he was
particularly focused on capturing their
familiar range-soaked dark spooky
atmosphere with more focus on horror
than action he specifically cites the
2019 remake of resident evil 2 as his
main and direct visual and tonal
inspiration for the film
every story has a beginning
discover the origin of evil he even
experimented with restrictive camera
angles that mimic the look of a video
game so sometimes for example the film
employs a high angle that almost looks
like surveillance video which would be
unnatural in a film but familiar to a
gamer as well sometimes a character will
walk off screen and then disappear for a
while without having the camera follow
them raccoon city was also front loaded
with a lot of game characters who only
found their way into the djokovic films
gradually over time including kaya
scodolario as claire redfield robbie
amell as chris redfield hannah john
cayman as jill valentine evan jogia as
leon s kennedy tom hopper as albert
wesker and lily gao as aydah wong the
2021 edition also integrated a few game
characters who had never previously been
featured in the films like neil
mcdonough as umbrella virologist william
birkin and donald logue as raccoon city
chief of police brian irons one element
the latest film shares with the previous
installments is practical effects
director paul jones he also created
nemesis in resident evil apocalypse and
the axe men for afterlife and
retribution and there you have it
everything you need to know about the
history of resident evil from our evil
residents to yours so until next time
don't forget your healing herbs watch
out for liquors and keep it here on rt
essentials for more slow methodical
walks down the long dark terrifying

i'm mark ellis and we'll see you real
soon
